column2: NEW MEXICO DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
1. Which shape is a railroad advance warning sign?
2. To avoid having to make an emergency stop while driving in traffic, drivers should:
column4: look ahead and maintain a safe following distance.
column6: drive slower than the flow of traffic.
column8: sound their horn to warn other drivers.
column10: drive in the right lane only.

column2: 3. As the percentage of alcohol in your blood (BAC) increases, you become:
4. This sign means:
5. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Area reserved for people with disabilities

column2: 6. To make a proper right turn:
column4: swing to the left before turning right.
column6: give the proper signal and get into the lane nearest the right curb.
column8: slow down and get into the lane nearest the centerline.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
8. This road sign means:
9. Stopping distances:
column6: are not affected by vehicle speed.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
11. The shape of a route sign tells you:
column4: how many miles are left before you reach your destination.
column6: the speed limit on that route.
column8: the type of route you are on.
column10: that the route you are on might be dangerous.

column2: 12. When an aggressive driver confronts you, you should:
column4: Report aggressive drivers to law enforcement authorities.

column2: 13. ___________ normally are white rectangles with black letters or symbols.
14. When passing a motorcycle, you must:
column4: have your vehicle entirely into the left lane before and during the pass.
column6: honk your horn to alert the motorcyclist.
column8: speed up above the speed limit and use your emergency lights to alert the motorcyle that you are about to pass.

column2: 15. You are coming to an intersection and have a green light. Pedestrians are crossing against the red. You should:
column4: speed up and pass in front of the pedestrians.
column8: claim your right-of-way and proceed with caution.
column10: stop to let pedestrians cross safely.

column2: 16. What happens if two vehicles reach at the same time an intersection with four-way stop signs?
column4: The driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column6: The first vehicle to reach the intersection must yield.
column8: The driver on the right yields to the driver on the left.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
18. This sign means:
column8: There is a traffic signal ahead

column2: 19. Drivers should use high beam headlights when:
column6: when they come within 50 feet of an oncoming vehicle.
column8: there are no oncoming vehicles approaching.

column2: 20. When you reach an intersection with stop signs at all four corners, you must yield the right-of-way to the driver:
21. This sign indicates that:
column4: drivers may not turn right if traveling at 25 MPH or less.
column6: the highest safe speed drivers should travel around the curve ahead is 25 MPH.
column8: the safe speed around the curve ahead is at least 25 MPH.
column10: there is a school zone after the curve.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
column6: You must come to a complete stop
column8: Drive with caution and be ready to stop

column2: 23. Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
column4: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.
column8: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.
column10: Only if the light is green.

column2: 24. This road sign indicates that:
column4: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.
column6: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.
column8: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.

column2: 25. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
